verses.text: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard \add it\add*, that he rent his clothes , and covered himself with sackcloth , and went into the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And he sent Eliakim , which \add was\add* over the household , and Shebna the scribe , and the elders of the priests , covered with sackcloth , to Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.

And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah , This day \add is\add* a day of trouble , and of rebuke , and blasphemy : for the children are come to the birth , and \add there is\add* not strength to bring forth.\f + \fr 19.3 \ft blasphemy: or, provocation\f*

It may be the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God will hear all the words of Rab-shakeh , whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God ; and will reprove the words which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God hath heard : wherefore lift up \add thy\add* prayer for the remnant that are left.  +  r 19.4  t left: Heb. found *
So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah. \p

¶ And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say to your master , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Be not afraid of the words which thou hast heard , with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour , and shall return to his own land ; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land. \p
¶ So Rab-shakeh returned , and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah : for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
And when he heard say of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia , Behold, he is come out to fight against thee: he sent messengers again unto Hezekiah , saying ,
Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah , saying , Let not thy God in whom thou trustest deceive thee, saying , Jerusalem shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands , by destroying them utterly : and shalt thou be delivered ?
Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed ; \add as\add* Gozan , and Haran , and Rezeph , and the children of Eden which \add were\add* in Thelasar ?
Where \add is\add* the king of Hamath , and the king of Arpad , and the king of the city of Sepharvaim , of Hena , and Ivah ? \p

¶ And Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers , and read it: and Hezekiah went up into the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and spread it before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And Hezekiah prayed before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said , O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel , which dwellest \add between\add* the cherubims , thou art the God , \add even\add* thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth ; thou hast made heaven and earth.

d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, bow down thine ear , and hear : open , 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, thine eyes , and see : and hear the words of Sennacherib , which hath sent him to reproach the living God.
Of a truth , \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the kings of Assyria have destroyed the nations and their lands ,
And have cast their gods into the fire : for they \add were\add* no gods , but the work of men’s hands , wood and stone : therefore they have destroyed them.\f + \fr 19.18 \ft cast: Heb. given\f*

Now therefore, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* our God , I beseech thee, save thou us out of his hand , that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou \add art\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God , \add even\add* thou only. \p

¶ Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah , saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , \add That\add* which thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.

This \add is\add* the word that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken concerning him; The virgin the daughter of Zion hath despised thee, \add and\add* laughed thee to scorn ; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed ? and against whom hast thou exalted \add thy\add* voice , and lifted up thine eyes on high ? \add even\add* against the Holy \add One\add* of Israel.

By thy messengers thou hast reproached the Lord , and hast said , With the multitude of my chariots I am come up to the height of the mountains , to the sides of Lebanon , and will cut down the tall cedar trees thereof, \add and\add* the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the lodgings of his borders , \add and into\add* the forest of his Carmel.\f + \fr 19.23 \ft By: Heb. By the hand of\f*\f + \fr 19.23 \ft tall…: Heb. tallness, etc\f*\f + \fr 19.23 \ft of his Carmel: or, and his fruitful field\f*
I have digged and drunk strange waters , and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of besieged places.\f + \fr 19.24 \ft besieged: or, fenced\f*

Hast thou not heard long ago \add how\add* I have done it, \add and\add* of ancient times that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste fenced cities \add into\add* ruinous heaps.\f + \fr 19.25 \ft long…: or, how I have made it long ago, and formed it of ancient times? should I now bring it to be laid waste, and fenced cities to be ruinous heaps?\f*

Therefore their inhabitants were of small power , they were dismayed and confounded ; they were \add as\add* the grass of the field , and \add as\add* the green herb , \add as\add* the grass on the housetops , and \add as corn\add* blasted before it be grown up.\f + \fr 19.26 \ft of small…: Heb. short of hand\f*
But I know thy abode , and thy going out , and thy coming in , and thy rage against me.\f + \fr 19.27 \ft abode: or, sitting\f*

Because thy rage against me and thy tumult is come up into mine ears , therefore I will put my hook in thy nose , and my bridle in thy lips , and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

And this \add shall be\add* a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such things as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap , and plant vineyards , and eat the fruits thereof.
And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall yet again take root downward , and bear fruit upward.\f + \fr 19.30 \ft remnant…: Heb. escaping of the house of Judah that remaineth\f*

For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant , and they that escape out of mount Zion : the zeal of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add \+w of hosts|strong="H6635"\+w*\add* shall do this.\f + \fr 19.31 \ft they…: Heb. the escaping\f*

Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* concerning the king of Assyria , He shall not come into this city , nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield , nor cast a bank against it.
By the way that he came , by the same shall he return , and shall not come into this city , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
For I will defend this city , to save it, for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake. \p

¶ And it came to pass that night , that the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* went out , and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand : and when they arose early in the morning , behold, they \add were\add* all dead corpses.
So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed , and went and returned , and dwelt at Nineveh.

And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god , that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword : and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esar-haddon his son reigned in his stead.\f + \fr 19.37 \ft Armenia: Heb. Ararat\f*
